document.docAuthor: Almeida, Alexandre O., Terossi, Mariana, Buranelli, Raquel C., Castilho, Antonio L., Costa, Rogério C., Zara, Fernando J. & Mantelatto, Fernando L.
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of decapods (Crustacea) from the coast of São Paulo State (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: II. Infraorder Caridea: family Alpheidae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of decapods (Crustacea) from the coast of São Paulo State (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: II. Infraorder Caridea: family Alpheidae

bibRefCitation.refString: McClure, M. (2002) Revised nomenclature of Alpheus angulatus McClure, 1995 (Decapoda: Caridea: Alpheidae). Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington, 115 (2), 368 - 370.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. Western Atlantic—USA (North Carolina to Florida), Gulf of
Mexico
, Caribbean Sea, French Guyana , Brazil (Atol das Rocas, Fernando de Noronha, Ceará , Paraíba , Bahia , Rio de Janeiro , São Paulo , Santa Catarina , Rio Grande do Sul ) (Anker 2012).

Remarks. Records of
A. armillatus H. Milne Edwards, 1837
along the coast of São Paulo ( e.g ., Holthuis 1956 ; Azambuja Corrêa & Loyola e Silva 1995 ;
Mossolin et al . 2006
;
Pavanelli et al . 2008
;
Amaral et al . 2010
) might correspond, at least in part, to
A. angulosus
or other species of the
A. armillatus
complex such as
A. brasileiro Anker, 2012
,
A. carlae Anker, 2012
, and
A. verrilli ( Schmitt, 1924 )
( Soledade & Almeida 2013 ).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. List of sampled localities of São Paulo coast, from north to south, including coordinates, sampling methods and alpheid shrimp species collected. Sampling methods: 1—SCUBA diving, rocky, coral and sandy area, captured by hand; 2—trawling; 3—association with algae
Sargassum
sp., captured by hand; 4—association with
Schizoporella
sp., captured by hand; 5—association with green sponges, captured by hand; 6—on the rocks, captured by hand; 7— association with
Phragmatopoma
reefs, captured by hand; 8—on sandy beach, captured by hand; 9—on mud beach, captured by hand; 10—suction pump. For 1 and 2, the depths were shown inside the parenthesis.
